glsa.title: Portage: Man-in-the-middle attack
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Portage's urlopen function could allow a remote attacker to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack.

background.p: Portage is the package management and distribution system for Gentoo.

description.p: Portage does not verify X.509 SSL certificates properly if HTTPS is used.

impact.p: A remote attacker can spoof servers and modify binary package lists via specially crafted certificates.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Portage users should upgrade to the latest version:
